channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Do you love customers? Senior Perl Developer with a product focus, London
item.description: Ever find yourself wishing you could see meaningful impact on users from your work? Trapped in a company with long release cycles and dubious release dates? Wish your ideas for product improvement didnâ€™t keep disappearing in to the Project Managerâ€™s backlog?

item.title: Independent thinkers required! Mid/Senior-level Developer for an innovative London company
item.description: Have you ever worked for a company with a micromanagement style, where a boss was constantly breathing down your neck? Do you hate spending more time in meetings about product requirements than actually getting on with building the product?

item.title: Perl Mongers of Wimbledon Common Are We - Perl Developer wanted in Wimbledon
item.description: Back in the day, the Wombles of Wimbledon collected rubbish. Nowadays, since the advent of motorised road sweepers, theyâ€™d be in need of a new profession. Perl Developer, perhaps? Our client is based in the heart of Wimbledon, under a mile away from the Common where the Wombles famously made their home.

item.title: German Perl Workshop 2018
item.description: Coming up quick is the German Perl Workshop, 4-6 April, at the Campus Gummersbach of the Technische Hochschule KÃ¶ln. A Perl 6 Hackathon will follow on the 7th of April, and the CFP has been extended to the 10th of March.

item.title: Swiss Perl Workshop 2018
item.description: Come to Bern on the 7th and 8th of September for the Swiss Perl Workshop. You can register now, and the CFP is open for this workshop in this historic city.

item.title: The Perl Conference in Europe
item.description: We're heading to Glasgow for the European conference, and the CFP is open!

item.title: The Perl Conference in North America
item.description: The NA conference will be held Sunday, 17 June, through Friday, 22 June, in Salt Lake City, Utah. This is the same hotel we were at 3 summers ago.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: Perl 6: On Specs, Versioning, Changes, and... Breakage
item.description: Zoffix gives us a cheese metaphor for the Perl 6 specification--it's full of holes! Ongoing development work fills those holes, and iteratively refines the specification.

item.title: 2018.08 Perl 6â€™ya GiriÅŸ
item.description: Another great roundup of the week's Perl 6 news

item.title: Guiding Fate
item.description: New contributor Saif Ahmed introduces GUIDeFATE, a tool for assiting in construction of GUI applications

item.title: Encode::Simple - Encode and decode text, simply
item.description: Dan releases a module to serve as a wrapper around Encode, to simplify its interface.

item.title: Safely load untrusted YAML in Perl
item.description: Tina gives us a primer on loading untrusted YAML using various modules.

item.title: Herding Moose (Mooses? Meece?)
item.description: John's frenzied pace of postings about Moose and DistZilla continues. Check out his blogs for the newest!

item.title: Updating the free Perl Maven tutorial
item.description: Last week I launched a new crowdfunding campaign to provide me with some time and encouragement to update the Perl Maven Tutorial. It had a very good start, but I'll need a lot more people to support it. If for nothing else, to see that you think it is valuable to you or to the Perl community in general. ~ Gabor

item.title: #344 - Lost in the cloud
item.description:
Hi there,

this is a bit mixed edition. Ruth collected the articles, but I (Gabor) decided on the title and I am writing this intro as well.

I also must apologize for the delay in sending out this edition, but I was on a flight from Sofia to Tel Aviv and apparently due to a 'navigation error' we first flew over Belgrade and then landed in Budapest. Then it took 2 hours to get on another plane and 3 more hours to arrive in Tel Aviv. Basically the pilot on the first plane got lost in the cloud.

I think I should look for some cloud and Perl-related articles...

Anyway, enjoy your week!

~ Gabor
